comments.body: @doncat I'm looking at this now. Do you have an example of a record that has an 852h already, so I can compare the data that comes out of alma with one that doesn't?

Anything with 852h beginning “item” followed by digits. That’s what we’ve used for in-process items. To be replaced by the new AbID.
Don

Subject: Re: [pulibrary/abid] AbID for MARC with Alma (#42)


@doncat<https://github.com/doncat> I'm looking at this now. Do you have an example of a record that has an 852h already, so I can compare the data that comes out of alma with one that doesn't?

@doncat I don't really have a way to search for that. Can you or someone else provide me an MMSID or holding ID for a record that has this 852h?

Thank you!
@doncat You're the best, thanks for taking the time finding that for me.

@doncat If given two items with two barcodes that are under the same holding and the same size category, should only one AbID be added as an 852, or should a second 852 be generated? If only one, then which one? The first one or the second one?

Edit: Or is it, like the last two examples in the document, that only one AbID should be generated? What happens if there's already an AbID in Alma? Don't generate anything?

Possible approach:

In parsing a MARCXML record from the publishing job, evaluate all items under each holding (linked by the subfield 0 in the 876 and the subfield 8 in the 852). If the item's current location (876|y and 876|z) is the same as the holding location, store the item under that holding ID.

If the item's current location is different from the holding location (the item is in a temp location), create a 'fake' holding for that location and store the item under that fake holding. Any subsequent items in that current location found on the bib record that differ from their parent holding locations also get stored under that fake holding. The same process needs to happen for all location variances found.

This will also allow us to show the items under a holding, which is a feature from Voyager we had to abandon.

bibdata.title: Renamed cgc key to cgd (collection group designation)

comments.body:
See https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1198 for some more discussion on this:

> Possible approach:
> 
> In parsing a MARCXML record from the publishing job, evaluate all items under each holding (linked by the subfield 0 in the 876 and the subfield 8 in the 852). If the item's current location (876|y and 876|z) is the same as the holding location, store the item under that holding ID.
> 
> If the item's current location is different from the holding location (the item is in a temp location), create a 'fake' holding for that location and store the item under that fake holding. Any subsequent items in that current location found on the bib record that differ from their parent holding locations also get stored under that fake holding. The same process needs to happen for all location variances found.
> 
> This will also allow us to show the items under a holding, which is a feature from Voyager we had to abandon.

There is at least one more collection code `FL` in addition to the `HW` that most things seem to be in.  Do we know which codes can be digitized?

AH DL FL GUT HB HC HJ HK HL HS HW HY MCZ ML TZ WL
